author: funnygiulio
content:
Posting about gas limit increase once again :P: I have been monitoring mainnet for a while - and this is how much my Erigon+Caplin node spends in each phase of executing a block (initial 4 secs of slot). Most of  the "Network latency" is most likely just timing games as this node in the US where most validators are. this means that execution+consensus overhead is pretty much <10% when it comes to actually processing a block. This means that from a processing perspective there is lots of room to grow.

**NOTE:** this is Erigon with a new chain tip performance improvement which pretty much tripled out performance on the tip of the chain so not sure if all clients can get exec that low - compared to geth it should be slightly faster.

author: kolbyml
content: Doesn't `Erigon+Caplin` not use the Engine API? and instead uses a more optimized integration. I wonder how this `optimized integration` compares with other clients which use the Engine API
